sub_topic: Solving nonlinear equations using Newton-Raphson method
message_1: Determine the root of the equation f(x) = x^3 - 5x + 3 using the Newton-Raphson method, starting with an initial guess of x = 2. Use 5 iterations and round your answers to four decimal places.
message_2:
To use the Newton-Raphson method, we first need to find the derivative of the function f(x) = x^3 - 5x + 3. The derivative, f'(x), is:

f'(x) = 3x^2 - 5

Now, we will apply the Newton-Raphson formula for 5 iterations, starting with the initial guess x = 2:

x_new = x_old - f(x_old) / f'(x_old)

Iteration 1:
x_old = 2
x_new = 2 - (2^3 - 5*2 + 3) / (3*2^2 - 5) = 2 - (8 - 10 + 3) / (12 - 5) = 2 - (1) / (7) = 1.8571

Iteration 2:
x_old = 1.8571
x_new = 1.8571 - ((1.8571)^3 - 5*(1.8571) + 3) / (3*(1.8571)^2 - 5) ≈ 1.8571 - (-0.1129) / 6.4877 ≈ 1.8743

Iteration 3:
x_old = 1.8743
x_new = 1.8743 - ((1.8743)^3 - 5*(1.8743) + 3) / (3*(1.8743)^2 - 5) ≈ 1.8743 - (-0.0017) / 6.6491 ≈ 1.8744

Iteration 4:
x_old = 1.8744
x_new = 1.8744 - ((1.8744)^3 - 5*(1.8744) + 3) / (3*(1.8744)^2 - 5) ≈ 1.8744 - (-0.0000) / 6.6509 ≈ 1.8744

Iteration 5:
x_old = 1.8744
x_new = 1.8744 - ((1.8744)^3 - 5*(1.8744) + 3) / (3*(1.8744)^2 - 5) ≈ 1.8744 - (-0.0000) / 6.6509 ≈ 1.8744

After 5 iterations, the root of the equation f(x) = x^3 - 5x + 3 is approximately x = 1.8744 (rounded to four decimal places).
